lines.text: I change my cars as regularly as a snake sheds its skin.
Do you have children?
Only when there are no men around.

[as Lady Marsh places the game of Snakes and Ladders into the fireplace]
Rosebud!

Fancy praying to a god who was nailed to a wooden cross, who locked up his brides in a convent. Did they really enjoy themselves, hmm? Poor little virgins masterbating in the dark and then in penance for their sins indulging in flagellation 'til their bodies wept tears of blood. Captive virgins, hmm, in the hands of an impotent god. Dionin will have none of that, Eve.
[last lines]
[James is driving with Angus, whom appears transformed at this point, along a country road]
So... who was that on the phone back there? Was it the hospital?

[gruff voice]
Hospital?
Yeah, was it about the girls and any updates on them?
No. It wasn't the girls.
Oh. Say... I'm famished. Before we go to the hospital to see the girls, do you want to stop some place for a bite?

[wickely smirks]
Why not?
Perfect.
No, the common earthworm was not always the lowly creatures it is today. Remember that the next time you bisect one with your shovel. You want some more?
[offering a spoonful]
Mmmm. It's very tasty!
Oh, good! So you've taken to our local specialty. Pickled earthworms in aspic is not to everyone's taste, I can tell you.
Dionin has a propensity for virgins, Eve, just like your false god. Problem is, they're so hard to come by these days. Aren't they, Eve?

[snatches a harmonica away from Kevin he played that briefly hypnotized her, catching her off-guard]
That's enough of that, Kevin! That sort of music freaks me out.

Now, if you're sitting comfortably, I shall tell you why you must not be afraid to die. To die so that the god may live is a privilege, Kevin, and if you know anything at all about history, you will know that human sacrifice is as old as Dionin himself, whose every death is a rebirth into a god ever mightier!
[doorbell rings]
Shit.
Can I help you?
Oh, your ladyship, I've been stung by a snake.
Snakes bite. Bees sting.
Yeah, it wouldn't be a bee this time of year.
Hardly a snake either. It's probably a nettle.
I'm not really into headbanging.
Are you into any kind of banging?
Oh, God, Kevin, you do have *appalling* B.O.! Save your breath... you've halitosis, too!
That's some system you've got there.
How do you rate the music?
I'm not really into it, banging.
Are you into any sort of banging?
I'm not bad on a mouth organ.

[chuckles]
You're sweet.
